Posts.Content: hi all Thanks for all your comments - lovely to  have these!   Sorry - forgot to say Happy New Year!  X
Posts.Title: Tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi all Just had second FEC last weds -  not too bad this time round. Given emend which helped with sickness. Still felt quite sick on first night and queasy on thurs/ fri but not actually sick.  What I am struggling with is a drink! I have always enjoyed water but it's not going done well?  Have tried bottled and tap - both just horrible.  Can't manage sparkling drinks including water and these burn and give  a sort of indigestion feeling!  I've never been a juice drinker or tea drinker and have gone right off my usual coffee!!! Any ideas anyone?  I know I am not drinking enough!
Posts.Title: Drink

Posts.Content: Hi all Positive on both- anyone else in same boat?  Was told this is unusual?  X
Posts.Title: Her2 and ER positive

Posts.Content: Thx for all your replies guys - it's so great to talk to people going through same!  Diagnosed with breast cancer - lumpectomy in nov and node removal.  Clear but due to type they want to give chemo as well radiotherapy.  You're right it's shocking when they use the words aggressive !   I have a chest line due to be inserted then chemo on same day - 17 Jan. 3 months FEC then T part also herceptin and radiotherapy and tamoxifen.  Bit of a slog but they seem to be chucking everything at it!  Thx again !
Posts.Title: Her2 and ER positive

Posts.Content: Hi all Thx for all the comments - really useful info.  Nice to know there are others out there!   My best wishes back to you all!  X
Posts.Title: Her2 and ER positive

Posts.Content: Actually I said shave but get it clippered not shaved - will be  better by clippers!!!!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Karen yeh - half of me feels these trials have determined it's sufficient and with side affects would be good for me to come off herceptin - other half thinks chuck everthing  as much as poss at it?!?  What a dilemma !!  Regards Kate
Posts.Title: Herceptin - how long for?

Posts.Content: Hi Maisie i am similar to you - at beginning thought only lumpectomy then radiotherapy but her2  positive so went down chemo route. Will have radiotherapy  afterwards then herceptin for a year as 3 weekly injections.   anyway to hair - definately shave or cut very short.  I felt so much better than having clumps come out!   Felt I took control!!!!  its really not that bad and I got a wig and had fun.  I don't mind people knowing I am wearing wig so went for a completely different style and having fun n with it!   chemo 5 tomorrow (second t ) and havimy 1st herceptin injection so have to stay at hospital for 6 hours!  Good book and and ipod!!!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Great post - thank you! im also on aspirin trial - so need to check I can take things with this! Nurses say occasional ibruprofen?
Posts.Title: Herceptin - how long for?

Posts.Content: G n J Thanks for information - great!  Notice from profile - I'm exactly like you ! Same diagnosis and treatment ! How did you find letrozole - was it herceptin and letrozole together  that caused most of bone aches or letrozole on it's own?  Kate
Posts.Title: Herceptin - how long for?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Doc has asked me to think about whether I want to stop Herceptin injections at 6 months instead of 12 ?  That would make next injection last one? This is due to Persephone trial showing 6 months as effective as 12 months.  I am very bone achy and on heart tablets due to heart not performing as it should??   What are people's thoughts on how long?
Posts.Title: Herceptin - how long for?
